name: Samsung Pass Backup
summary: Learn about .SPASS files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Samsung Pass is a password manager that Samsung smartphone users can install on their phones. It allows users to store website and app login credentials, credit card information, and addresses, and use their fingerprint or iris to quickly enter that information in websites and apps.
Optionally, users can back up the information they've entered in Samsung Pass. To do so they:
Select General management → Passwords and autofill.
Select the Settings icon that appears next to Autofill with Samsung Pass.
Verify their identity to log in to Samsung Pass.
Tap the three-dot menu and select Settings → Export data to phone.
Select the data they want to back up, enter a password used to encrypt the data, and finish exporting the data.
This backs up the user's Samsung Pass data in an SPASS file. Because SPASS files are encrypted, they can be opened and used only with Samsung Pass.

instructions: You can open an SPASS file with Samsung Pass (Android) to import the credentials it contains. To do so:
Select General management → Passwords and autofill.
Select the Settings icon that appears next to Autofill with Samsung Pass.
Verify your identity to log in to Samsung Pass.
Tap the three-dot menu and select Settings → Import data.
Navigate to, select, and import your SPASS file. As part of this process, you must verify your identity and enter the password you used to create your SPASS file.
